title: Functions reading specific input data, e.g. files provided by BWB

what: Get All Grab Sample Data (1) — hsGetAllGsData1
title: Get All Grab Sample Data (1) — hsGetAllGsData1
text: get Senate's grab sample data (type 1) csv files directory return "--one-table" data frame

title: Get All Grab Sample Data (1) — hsGetAllGsData1
code: hsGetAllGsData1(   csvdir,   sep = ";",   dateFormat = "%d.%m.%Y",   dec = ",",   data.block.number = NA,   csvFiles = dir(csvdir, "*.csv", full.names = TRUE) )

title: Get All Grab Sample Data (1) — hsGetAllGsData1
text: csvdir absolute path directory csv files read  located. sep separator csv file, e.g. ";" "," dateFormat date format specifier describing format dates  represented csv file. Use placeholders , "%d" (day),  "%m" (month), "%y" (2-digit year), "%Y" (4-digit year) describe date format. "%d.%m.%Y", "%d/%m/%y", "%Y-%m-%d" examples valid format specifiers. dec decimal character: "." "," data.block.number passed hsGetGsData1,  description see . csvFiles vector full paths csv files read. files must contain data monitoring points, order! Default: csv files csvdir

what: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data from CSV (type 1) — hsGetGsData1
title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data from CSV (type 1) — hsGetGsData1
text: SENATE's grab sample data read csv file (type 1) returned forms list (see Value section ). csv file expected  contain grab sample data exactly one monitoring point. format  description csv file see Details section .

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data from CSV (type 1) — hsGetGsData1
code: hsGetGsData1(   csv,   sep = ";",   dateFormat = "%d.%m.%Y",   dec = ",",   data.block.number = NA,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data from CSV (type 1) — hsGetGsData1
text: csv full path csv file sep separator csv file, e.g. ";" "," dateFormat date format specifier describing format dates  represented csv file. Use placeholders , "%d" (day),  "%m" (month), "%y" (2-digit year), "%Y" (4-digit year) describe date format. "%d.%m.%Y", "%d/%m/%y", "%Y-%m-%d" examples valid format specifiers. dec decimal character: "." "," data.block.number file contains data one  monitoring point, data.block.number needs integer number  one number monitoring points data provided file. data monitoring point corresponding given  number extracted. data.block.number NA (default)  expected file contains data one monitoring point.  program stop data provided one monitoring point dbg TRUE (default), debug messages shown

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data from CSV (type 1) — hsGetGsData1
text: Grab sample data returned forms list, e.g.: Within sub-structures representing parameters, parTxt contains values text format read file, parValcontains values converted text double parLim contains characters indicating underrunning exceedance detection limits, extracted parTxt.

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data from CSV (type 1) — hsGetGsData1
text: csv file expected look like following example. structured blocks represents measured parameter. Within block grab sample results organized three columns: 1. sample date, 2. measurement value, 3. character indicating detection limit underrun exceeded. (see Parameter Sichttiefe example ). third column empty detection limit underrun exceeded (almost data lines example ).

what: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data From CSV (type 2) — hsGetGsData2
title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data From CSV (type 2) — hsGetGsData2
text: SENATE's grab sample data read csv file (type 2) returned forms list (see Value section ). csv file expected contain grab sample data one monitoring point, organized sections contains measurement results available  parameters matrix-style format. format description csv file see Details section .

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data From CSV (type 2) — hsGetGsData2
code: hsGetGsData2(   csv,   sep = ";",   dateFormat = "%d.%m.%Y",   dec = ",",   blockBeginPtrn = PATTERN_STATION(),   dbg = FALSE,   outlevel = 1 )

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data From CSV (type 2) — hsGetGsData2
text: csv full path csv file sep separator csv file, e.g. ";" "," dateFormat date format specifier describing format dates  represented csv file. Use placeholders , "%d" (day),  "%m" (month), "%y" (2-digit year), "%Y" (4-digit year) describe date format. "%d.%m.%Y", "%d/%m/%y", "%Y-%m-%d" examples valid format specifiers. dec decimal character: "." "," blockBeginPtrn pattern indicating begin data block  file dbg TRUE (default), debug messages shown outlevel Output level. Expected values 1 2. default 1. output level 2, raw data block passed  kwb.read:::.hsExtractData returned.

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data From CSV (type 2) — hsGetGsData2
text: Grab sample data returned forms list, e.g.:
code: $ moniPoint:List of 2   ..$ mpID  : chr , e.g. "730"   ..$ mpName: chr , e.g. "Panke, Muendung (Nordhafen-Vorbecken) (0,5 m)"   $ byPar    :List    ..$ <parID1>:List of 7   .. ..$ parID  : chr , e.g. "10001"   .. ..$ parName: chr , e.g. "Lufttemperatur"   .. ..$ parUnit: chr , e.g. "<degree>C"   .. ..$ smpDate: Date[], format: ...   .. ..$ parTxt : chr [], e.g. "3,000" "4,000" "9,300" "19,900" ...   .. ..$ parVal : num [], e.g. 3 4 9.3 19.9 12.1 13.1 19.6 28 13.9 7.2 ...   .. ..$ parLim : chr [], e.g. "" "<" "<" "" ...   ..$ <parID2> ...

title: Read SENATE's Grab Sample Data From CSV (type 2) — hsGetGsData2
text: csv file expected look like following example. structured blocks represents monitoring point. , different format supported hsGetGsData1 block represents measured parameter one monitoring point per file. , block starts line naming monitoring point, followed header line showing names units analysed parameters. header line followed data lines represents sample sample data measured values according names header line. value fields may contain leading character indicating detection limit underrun exceeded. (Shortened) example input file:

code: read_BWB_rain_correction_long(   files,   sep = ";",   country = c("de", "en")[1],   date.format = "%A %d. %B %Y",   locale = .localeString(country),   wide = TRUE,   dbg = TRUE )

title: Read BWB Rain Correction Data — read_BWB_rain_correction_long
text: files full path CSV file containing rain height correction data "long" format sep column separator files country one "de" (German) "en" (English) according format numeric strings given date.format format used convert date string date object locale locale string, passed read_BWB_rain_correction_long wide TRUE (default) data returned "wide" format, .e. date first column column  representing rain gauge dbg logical. TRUE, debug messages shown.

title: Read BWB Rain Correction Data — read_BWB_rain_correction_long
text: data frame either "wide" format (date first column   rain heights following columns named according   "object ids" rain gauges) "long" format (columns Date, ObjNrPumpwerkNiederschlag). mapping   object ids gauge names returned attribute "gauges".

title: Read BWB Rain Correction Data — read_BWB_rain_correction_long
code: if (FALSE) { # Provide the path to an example file in this package file <- "Niederschlag_example.csv" file <- system.file("extdata", file, package = "kwb.read")    # Read the CSV file into a data frame in "long" format correction.wide <- read_BWB_rain_correction_long(file)    # Read the CSV file into a data frame in "wide" format (gauges in columns) correction.long <- read_BWB_rain_correction_long(file, wide = FALSE)    # Get the mapping between object IDs and gauge names from attribute "gauges" kwb.utils::getAttribute(correction.wide, "gauges") }

what: Read Rain Data from BWB Excel Files — read_rain
title: Read Rain Data from BWB Excel Files — read_rain
text: Read Rain Data BWB Excel Files

title: Read Rain Data from BWB Excel Files — read_rain
code: read_rain(   directory = kwb.utils::resolve("RAIN_DIR", dictionary),   pattern = kwb.utils::resolve("RAIN_XLS_PATTERN", dictionary),   tableName = kwb.utils::resolve("RAIN_XLS_TABLE", dictionary),   dictionary = kwb.utils::selectElements(settings, "dictionary"),   rain.xls.files = dir(directory, pattern, full.names = TRUE),   aggregation.interval = kwb.utils::selectElements(settings,     "rain.aggregation.interval"),   settings = NULL,   use2007Driver = TRUE )

title: Read Rain Data from BWB Excel Files — read_rain
text: directory directory containing excel files rain data read. Default: kwb.utils::resolve("RAIN_DIR", dictionary) pattern file name pattern matching names files read. Default: kwb.utils::resolve("RAIN_XLS_PATTERN", dictionary) tableName name sheet excel files containing rain data. Default: kwb.utils::resolve("RAIN_XLS_TABLE", dictionary) dictionary list key/value pairs can used dictionary look following keywords (directory, pattern,  tableName given): RAIN_DIR, RAIN_XLS_PATTERN, RAIN_XLS_TABLE rain.xls.files full paths xls xlsx files read. given, paths used. Otherwise files directory matching filename pattern used. aggregation.interval aggregation interval seconds. Default:  settings$rain.aggregation.interval settings list may contain arguments function elements rain.aggregation.interval dictionary use2007Driver passed getAggregatedBwbRainDataFromExcelFiles

title: Read Rain Data from BWB Excel Files — read_rain
text: data frame column DateTime containing timestamps UTC    timezone representing Berlin normal (= winter) time.

title: Read XML File as Pairs of Paths and Values — read_xml_as_path_value
code: url <- "https://www.w3schools.com/xml/note.xml"  # Original XML content kwb.utils::catLines(readLines(url, warn = FALSE)) #> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> #> <note> #>   <to>Tove</to> #>   <from>Jani</from> #>   <heading>Reminder</heading> #>   <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body> #> </note>  # Interpretation as Paths and Values kwb.read:::read_xml_as_path_value(url) #> Reading 'note.xml' in folder #>   'https://www.w3schools.com/xml' ... ok. #>            path                         value #> 1      /note/to                          Tove #> 2    /note/from                          Jani #> 3 /note/heading                      Reminder #> 4    /note/body Don't forget me this weekend!
